image.altText: A close up shot of a tanned man, gray hair, black-framed glasses, plaid pattern button up shirt.

props.synopsis: Central Land Council chief executive Lesley Turner — who is suing Jacinta Nampijinpa Price for defamation — testifies in Federal Court, and denies being "embarrassed" by the senator pointing out alleged "failures" of the council.

title.children: Land council boss testifies against Senator Nampijinpa Price in defamation trial

image.altText: A woman with glasses speaking to the media.

props.synopsis: The NT attorney-general's department has taken the extraordinary step of releasing private emails between a top judge and bureaucrats, to try and address allegations of interference.

title.children: NT attorney-general's department releases private emails with top judge

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal mourners walking through a coles supermarket, while holding branches.

props.synopsis: Supermarket giant Coles is among the parties expected to take part in a coronial inquest into the death in custody of a young Aboriginal man inside its Alice Springs shop earlier this year.

title.children: Coles to appear at death in custody inquest, as family calls for answers

image.altText: Beryl sits outside in the sunlight in front of a tree, looking at the camera with an inscrutable expression.

props.synopsis: As the Northern Territory prison population continues to reach all-time highs, data reveals a majority of the NT's rehab program are being cancelled more often than they are being delivered.

title.children: NT prisons so crammed 'girls are sleeping at reception'

image.altText: Men in white coats looking at beef carcasses inside an abattoir.

props.synopsis: A cattle company in Western Australia's Kimberley has struck a deal with a Northern Territory abattoir to get local beef to consumers in remote communities.

title.children: Indigenous cattle company supplying affordable beef to remote areas

image.altText: A women with short dark hair and glasses looks seriously at the camera.

props.synopsis: IUDs can be inserted by GPs, gynaecologists and family planning doctors, but in Alice Springs there aren't enough local professionals trained to do so.

title.children: Women waiting months, considering interstate travel for birth control

image.altText: A grinning Barnaby Joyce holds a lump of coal in the House of Representatives

props.synopsis: Threatening to euthanase Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's dogs, repeatedly calling out "caaarp" in parliament, that notorious moment on a Canberra footpath, Barnaby Joyce's career has had plenty of colour and movement.

title.children: From Pistol and Boo to leaked texts, Joyce has always run his own race

image.altText: Man holding phone horizontally while wearing body camera on a property that looks like a farm with mountain in the background

props.synopsis: Mount Buffalo National Park will open to everyone as Victoria Police's search for Dezi Freeman continues with the creation of a new taskforce.

title.children: Freeman search continues as Mount Buffalo fully reopens to public

image.altText: A split image showing Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump, both in suits.

props.synopsis: The Russian president acknowledged that the move to sanction two oil companies would have "certain consequences", but would not significantly impact the country's economy.

title.children: 'Unfriendly' US oil sanctions will have little effect, Putin says

image.altText: A man being led by police.

props.synopsis: Police allege three men falsely claimed to be mediating between a construction company and unions to prevent disruptions at buildings sites.

title.children: Three men charged with alleged $6.6 million construction extortion

image.altText: Close up of girl's face with large bump on forehead.

props.synopsis: More than a year after her 21-month-old child was hit by an e-bike, a Newcastle mother is calling for change.

title.children: Mother calls for tougher laws after toddler run down by e-bike

image.altText: Mobile vision of two people descending down a crane to a street.

props.synopsis: Video shared widely on social media appears to show alleged Louvre jewellery thieves escaping on a crane near the Seine.

title.children: New video appears to show alleged Louvre thieves escaping in Paris

image.altText: Tributes laid on grass

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged with murder and arson after a house fire that took the lives of a woman and two young children in Gladstone.

title.children: Woman charged with murder, arson after house fire kills three

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a beige and brown patterned shirt stands at a lectern, with four Pacific leaders behind him.

props.synopsis: Beijing reprimanded Pacific Island nation ambassadors for including Taiwan in the regional summit last month, but Australia and New Zealand have lent their support.

title.children: Australia backs Pacific Islands facing China heat over Taiwan

image.altText: Office-worker watches share prices at the ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is losing steam in afternoon trade, while the Aussie dollar is also in the red. US President Donald Trump took to social media to declare trade negotiations with Canada over. Follow live.

title.children: ASX and Aussie dollar down, RBA Governor backs cash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Donald Trump  says all US trade negotiations with Canada are terminated
US can't compete with China's dominance in the critical minerals space: AMP economists

image.altText: An illustration of someone sitting in front of a computer with an AI prompt

props.synopsis: Staff and a union say a generative AI model being tested in Australian Community Media's regional newspapers is misattributing facts and leaving some fearing for their jobs.

title.children: Regional newsroom staff say AI rollout leading to potential errors

image.altText: A black and white image of viper biting into a gel cylinder, a tiled background.

props.synopsis: Dozens of species of snakes have been captured on high-speed cameras, with researchers finding vipers were the fastest, but an Australian snake was not far behind.

title.children: Snakes can strike faster than your brain tells your muscles to move

image.altText: A hand holds a mobile phone with the screen showing several social media apps

props.synopsis: Police did not know his name but they did have his Snapchat handle. From there, detectives pieced together a case that would reveal the true identity of sex offender 'Alec'.

title.children: The digital breadcrumb that led police to 'Alec', a child sex offender

image.altText: A submarine at the surface with morning sun on its right flank, the ocean stretches behind it

props.synopsis: In Washington on Monday, Anthony Albanese made something clear once again: Australia is all-in on the trilateral defence pact. Clarifying what US powerbrokers think remains a multi-billion-dollar question.

title.children: Australia is all in on AUKUS. In Donald Trump's America, it's more complicated

image.altText: Chauncey Billups yells at a referee

props.synopsis: Seven years ago, the United States crossed a line that it once dared to never cross, leading to a string of arrests that threaten to tarnish sports in the country for generations to come.

title.children: US faces a reckoning after blurring line between gambling and sport

image.altText: Harrie Lavreysen holds up the hand of Leigh Hoffman

props.synopsis: Australia's team pursuit squad and keirin rider Leigh Hoffman have both claimed silver medals on day two of the UCI track world championships in Santiago, Chile.

title.children: Hoffman steps up with sensational keirin silver

image.altText: The sun in a cloudy sky sets over a beach

props.synopsis: Temperatures are set to reach above 40 degrees in some places, with more hospital admissions likely because of heat-related illness.

title.children: 'Huge bubble of hot air' across northern Australia as heatwave persists

image.altText: .A young woman with fair skin and brown hair

props.synopsis: Despite one in four sufferers being under 65, experts say there is a common misconception that strokes only occur in older people. Mental well-being is key to recovery but is often more difficult for younger stroke survivors.

title.children: Elena was a fit and healthy 20-year-old — then she had a stroke

image.altText: A graphic with an ambulance in the background, a phone with 000 on it and the logo of Telstra, Optus and Vodafone.

props.synopsis: A Vodafone customer who was repeatedly unable to ring triple-0 says the major telco failed to help her fix the problem for months.

title.children: Vodafone gave mixed messaging over service issues with triple-0, customer says

image.altText: Mummy of a duck-billed dinosaur resting on its ribcage.

props.synopsis: The duck-billed dinosaur was only a few years old when it died. Scientists now believe the species had hooves on its feet.

title.children: Rare dinosaur mummies show species had hooves

image.altText: A black object on a dusty red dirt road.

props.synopsis: How closely were you following the news this week? Test yourself to find out!

title.children: News quiz: A jewel heist, an awkward Trump moment and an outback mystery

image.altText: An X-ray showing metallic items in a boy's abdominal area.

props.synopsis: Surgeons in New Zealand remove part of the 13-year-old boy's bowel after he obtained banned magnets online.

title.children: Teenager has surgery after swallowing 100 magnets

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A search is underway on NSW Mid North Coast for the remains of Colleen Walker-Craig, who went missing within months of two other children in Bowraville.

title.children: Police divers complete 'gaps' in 1990 search for murdered teen

image.altText: Two men are holding a fabric with a camouflage military pattern inside a factory.

props.synopsis: As US President Donald Trump visits South-East Asia amid global trade tensions, Indonesian exporters worry the region could bear the brunt of his protectionist policies.

title.children: Trump's tariffs would change this city once known as Indonesia’s textile hub

image.altText: Woman in black dress walking on path in botanic garden leading a group of five women, among green shrubbery and trees.

props.synopsis: A growing number of women are entering the in-demand cultural tourism field in which First Nations guides share treasured knowledge.

title.children: Indigenous women lead increasingly popular cultural tourism trend

image.altText: A low angle shot of a black bike seat with a woman standing behind, back to the camera.

props.synopsis: "Saddle soreness" is a common complaint among cyclists. These innovators are looking at creative ways to prevent it by redesigning the bike seat.

title.children: Could a new bike seat prevent saddle pain? These innovators think so

image.altText: A fire burns around an ornate metal staircase

props.synopsis: Jonathan Rinderknecht, 29, is charged with "maliciously" starting a fire in January that killed 12 people. If he is convicted he could spend up to 45 years in jail.

title.children: LA's Pacific Palisades fire suspect pleads not guilty

image.altText: GettyImages-2178235912

props.synopsis: Kenya's Ruth Chepngetich is banned from athletics for three years over a doping violation.

title.children: Marathon world record-holder banned for three years over doping violation

image.altText: An old book tearing at the seams.

props.synopsis: There are many factors that can determine the monetary value of a book, so what can make an edition worth tens of thousands of dollars?

title.children: $40k price tag on The Hobbit raises hopes for other rare books
